data.title: Wayne Rooney to join TNT Sports' coverage of Manchester United v Everton in the Premier League
data.meta_description: Wayne Rooney will be joining TNT Sports’ coverage of Everton’s Premier League trip to Old Trafford to play Manchester United on Saturday.
data.text:
Wayne Rooney will be joining TNT Sports’ coverage of Everton’s trip to Old Trafford to play Manchester United on Saturday, March 9.

The former England captain will join ex-Manchester United team-mate Rio Ferdinand as well as Joleon Lescott pitchside, offering insights and analysis into the two Premier League clubs he played for with distinction during his storied 19-year playing career.

The build-up to Manchester United vs Everton on TNT Sports 1 starts with Early Kick-Off from 11:00 UK time fronted by Jules Breach, before handing over to Lynsey Hipgrave from 11:30.

The match kicks off at 12:30 with Darren Fletcher lead-commentator and Lucy Ward on co-commentary duty.

The clash will also be available to stream via discovery+.

Championship

‘Perfect next step’ – Rooney appointed new Plymouth head coach

25/05/2024 at 13:53

Rooney started his professional career at boyhood club Everton before leaving to join Manchester United in 2004.

He spent 13 years with United, becoming the club's all-time top scorer, winning five Premier League titles and a UEFA Champions League.

He then returned to Everton for one season before heading to the MLS with D.C. United.

Rooney recently expressed his desire to manage Manchester United or Everton in the future.

"Managing Manchester United or Everton is the aim, these big jobs are where you want to get to," said Rooney, who most recently managed Birmingham City.

"But it's a process. I have got to go through the steps and get myself back on track."

United will be looking to return to winning ways after losing to Manchester City 3-1 in the Manchester derby.

Erik ten Hag's side are sixth in the Premier League table, 11 points behind fourth-placed Aston Villa.

Everton are five points above the relegation zone after seeing their 10-point deduction for a breach of Premier League financial rules reduced to six.

Sean Dyche’s side were most recently beaten 3-1 by West Ham.

Wayne Rooney major honours:

Premier League – 2006-07, 2007-08, 2008-09, 2010-11, 2012-13

FA Cup – 2015-16

League Cup – 2005-06, 2009-10, 2016-17

UEFA Champions League – 2007-08

UEFA Europa League – 2016-17

FIFA Club World Cup - 2008

- - -

TNT Sports presents the premium live sports rights previously carried by BT Sport including the Premier League, UEFA Champions League, UEFA Europa League, UEFA Conference League, Gallagher Premiership Rugby, Investec Champions Cup, EPCR Challenge Cup, MotoGP, Cricket, UFC, Boxing, NBA and WWE. The streaming home for TNT Sports in the UK is discovery+, where fans can enjoy a subscription that includes TNT Sports, Eurosport and entertainment in one destination. You can also watch TNT Sports through BT, EE, Sky, and Virgin Media.
